result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis Luis Quinones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*If revoked and sentenced to prison. The department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account of reasonable amounts as determined by DOC to be used for payment of obligations. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. If  discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*Comply with the conditions of Extended Supervision in 21CF484
*Submit DNA Sample

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on October 25, 2022
Letter to Judge Baker from Atty Maxwell Bergner in Re: Sentence Credit (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 10/27/22 sp)

Count 1:  Imposed but STAYED Prison Sentence with Extended Supervision and Placed on Probation
Counts 2 - 4:  Dismissed and Read In
Letter to Judge Baker Regarding Sentence Credit for 21CF484, 22CF52 & 22CF81 filed by the State (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 10/26/22 sp)

3:13 PM Defendant Alexis Luis Quinones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Alexis Luis Quinones.  Assistant District  Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are :  21CF484, 22CF52 & 22CF81.

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Court goes over the plea agreement in this case with the parties.
State would be requesting 84 month prison sentence with 42 months of initial confinement and 42 months of extended supervision.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victim(s) appear in court today.
Court questions if ADA Dodge had received the defendant's sentencing memorandum.
ADA Dodge did receive this and he did review prior to today.
Court informs the parties that the restitution summary shows $7,377.06 being owed for restitution.
Court provides Atty Bergner a copy of the restitution summary to review and informs the defendant that he is entitled to a restitution hearing if he does no agree with the amount.
Atty Bergner makes statements to the court with regards to the restitution.
Court questions if any victim impact statements had been filed in any of the cases that had been dismissed and read in.
Court questions the victim/witness coordinator if there are any victim impact statements in the dismissed and read in cases; she is reviewing these cases at this time and will let the Court know.


Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
ADA Dodge has no corrections or errors to the PSI.
Atty Bergner states that on page 50 of the PSI there is an error and states this on the record.
Probation Agent responds to the issue stated on the record by Atty Bergner.
ADA Dodge makes statements with regards to this issue also.
Court makes a further record of the issue stated by Atty Bergner.
Atty Bergner has no additional corrections.
State is in compliance with victim notification legislation.
No victim impact statements were located in any dismissed and read in cases.
3:25 p.m.  Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
3:38 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Court wants Atty Bergner to turn his attention to the psychological evaluation completed on his client.
Court reviews the psychological evaluation portion of the PSI. 
Court questions Atty Bergner if he wishes to make comment on the psychological portion of the PSI.
Atty Bergner makes a record of this portion of the PSI.
Court gives the defendant the opportunity to address the Court.
Defendant has written a letter and wishes to read this to the Court.
Atty Bergner will read the letter into the record on behalf of his client.
3:57 p.m.  Court questions the defendant.
Court references page 24 of the PSI.

BY THE COURT: 
21CF484:
Count 1 -
Prison Sentence of 66 months 
Initial Confinement:  30 months 
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Sentence credit to be determined
Extended Supervision:  36 months
**Conditions of Extended Supervision - 
No contact with any victims.
No contact with known drug users or drug dealers.
No contact with any gang members or participating in any gang activities.
Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. 
Only consume prescription medication in the manner and dosage prescribed.
Obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations, including counseling and taking medications as prescribed.
Successfully complete AODA, CGIP and Anger Management Assessments and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations.
Attend support meetings.
Maintain employment or actively seek employment by providing documentation of at least 10 applications submitted weekly until employment can be obtained. If employment cannot be obtained, must volunteer 10 hours of time per week until employed or participate in an educational program.
Complete programming as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections
Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees
Pay restitution - Atty Bergner will be allowed 30 days to provide a letter to the Court with regards to a request for a restitution hearing
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample 

22CF52:
Count 1 -
Prison Sentence of 66 months - concurrent with 21CF484
Initial Confinement:   30 months 
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Sentence credit to be determined 
Extended Supervision:  36 months 
**Conditions of Extended Supervision -
Comply with the conditions of Extended Supervision in 21CF484
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample 

22CF81:
Count 1 -
Imposed but STAYED Prison Sentence of 36 months - consecutive with 21CF484 and 22CF52
Initial Confinement:  18 months
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Sentence Credit is to be determined 
Extended Supervision:  18 months 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 24 Months - 
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of Extended Supervision in 21CF484
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample 

Parties are to provide a letter to the Court with regards to sentence credit and restitution (by Atty Bergner).

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:07 AM Defendant Alexis Luis Quinones in court, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Alexis Luis Quinones.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 21CF317, 21CF361, 21CF473, 21CF478, 21CF484, 21CF487, 21CM7, 21CM221, 21CM233, 21CM326, 22CF52, 22CF81, 22CM75

Atty Pfeil states the appearances. 
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Will be filing an amended information which combines all similar charges in the dismissed and read-in cases for amended counts 1 and 2.  Asks to submit a summary for restitution within the next 30 days for the parties to review.  If it is not approved, then there would be a hearing on that. 
Court questions if the state is requesting a pre-sentence investigation (PSI). 
Atty Pfeil indicates the state is not asking for one but does not object if defense requests one. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.  

Court questions Atty Pfeil with regards to the amended information and statute 943.01(2)(d). 
Atty Bergner agrees. 
Defendant received copy of the amended information.
Defendant waives reading of the amended information. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF81 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
22CF52 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
21CF484 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Defendant agrees he has been convicted of a felony prior to this date. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following:
22CF81 Count 1 - Felony criminal damage as a repeater 943.01(2)(d) & 939.62(1)(b)
22CF52 Count 1 - Possession of firearm by a felony 941.29(1m)(a)
21CF484 Count 1 - Drive or operate motor vehicle without owners consent 943.23
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
Court finds the defendant does hold the repeater status.  

Court questions parties regarding PSI request. 
Neither party are requesting a PSI. 
Court questions if the parties are able to provide enough information to the court. 
Atty Bergner states he filed a sentencing memorandum and therefore they will not be requesting that. It was filed at the time the hearing started. 

9:41 a.m. Court goes off the record. 
9:42 a.m. Court is back on the record.

Court questions the parties regarding one complaint indicating he was in prison previously. 
Atty Pfeil responds and confirms. 
Court makes statements regarding time to review the sentencing memorandum and if a psychological evaluation may be helpful.  Court is uncomfortable moving forward with so many serious charges without a PSI. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be done and filed by October 14, 2022. 
If Atty Bergner updates the sentencing memorandum or prepares an alternative PSI that is to be done by October 21, 2022. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victims are not present to make statements. 

BY THE COURT: 
The following are dismissed and read-in: 
22CM75, 
22CF81 Counts 2 thru 4, 
22CF52 Counts 2 thru 11,
21CF487 in its entirety,
21CF478 in its entirety,
21CF473 in its entirety,
21CM326 in its entirety,
21CF361 in its entirety,
21CF317 in its entirety,
21CM233 in its entirety,
21CM221 in its entirety,
21CM7 in its entirety.
State will be held to its sentence cap of 42 months.  
Bond is revoked. 
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Portage County sheriff pending sentencing.

Off the record: 
BY THE COURT: Clerk directed to indicate on the PSI that there be a psychological evaluation.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner on 08/29/22 @ 7:57 a.m.  (sent to Br 3 Judge on 08/29/22 sp)
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 08/26/22
Plea/Sentencing set for 08/29/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Judge Patricia Baker assigned
/s/LJM 6-29-2022. Approved.

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alexis Luis Quinones appeared in court, Attorney Maxwell Bergner appeared in court for Alexis Luis Quinones. 
ADA Pfeil calls Officer Justin Klein who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy and Andrew Mutchler appears in court.  New charges 22GF49 and Return on Warrants for 21CM7, 21CM221, 21CM233, 21CF317, 21CF361, and 21CM326.
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Entry into Locked Vehicle, Bail Jumping, Criminal Damage to Property, Operate Vehicle without Consent and possible a total of 50 some charges. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions if the State has complied with victim rights.
No victims are present today.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner's objections as to bond are heard. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond.
21CM7, 21CM221, 21CM233, 21CF317, 21CF361, and 21CM326 Warrants are quashed.
